data.text:
Actor Yahya Abdul-Mateen II (book-based film "Candyman") has been chosen to lead the cast of the upcoming, book-based TV series titled "Man on Fire". Netflix is involved in the adaptation. The show will have eight episodes and is based on the book series that inspired the 2004 hit film starring Denzel Washington and Dakota Fanning, as well as a 1987 Italian film featuring Scott Glenn. Kyle Killen (book-based film "Fear Street") will be the writer, executive producer, and showrunner for the series. The TV Series will focus on the first two books ("Man on Fire" and "The Perfect Kill") in the five-book series by A.J. Quinnell (pen name: Philip Nicholson).

Similar Topic: Charlie Hunnam To Star In The Amazon Series Adaptation Of ‘Criminal’

The production of the series is New Regency Productions and Chernin Entertainment, with a team of executive producers including Abdul-Mateen II, Steven Caple Jr., Peter Chernin, Jenno Topping, Bill McGoldrick, Juan Alfonso, Arnon Milchan, Yariv Milchan, and Michael Schaefer.

Here is the goodreads synopsis of Man on Fire by A.J. Quinnell:

Known only as Creasy, he was hired to protect, not to kill. A battle-scarred, burnt-out mercenary, working as a bodyguard for the young daughter of an Italian industrialist, he thought he had lost the power of feeling. Until the girl's beguiling touch awakens in him the ability to love.

Then something happens, something so devastating that Creasy is consumed by a single-minded rage for revenge. And at a stroke he is transformed into the terrifying killing machine he was trained to be...

Here is the goodreads synopsis of The Perfect Kill by A.J. Quinnell:

Three days before Christmas in 1988,a bomb blew Pan Am 103 out of the sky over the small Scottish town of Lockerbie, killing all passengers and crew. The wife and four year old daughter of Creasy were amongst the passengers. Seeking his personal vengeance, Creasy finds the backup of power-a US Senator, whose wife also died on Pan Am 103: and of youth-an eighteen year old orphan called Michael. Ruthlessly and relentlessly, Creasy trains Michael into becoming a man in his own image. Trains him...for the perfect kill.

​Source: Deadline
